title: 'Defect in fuel switch': Air India pilot flags issue with 787-8 Dreamliner; plane grounded
content: Air India has grounded a Boeing 787 Dreamliner after its crew reported a fuel control switch issue post-landing. This follows a 2025 crash where a similar switch malfunction led to engine failure. The airline is investigating with the manufacturer, while aviation regulators are also probing the incident, raising safety concerns.

title: 'Arrogant, liar': Mamata flays EC chief over SIR; warns can bring 'lakhs of people to Delhi'
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee hit out at CEC Gyanesh Kumar and called him 'arrogant' and 'liar' post meeting. The remarks came amid the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in West Bengal. Banerjee and her party Trinamool Congress have called the exercise as biased, discriminatory and politically motivated.

title: Dhurandhar's warning: Why Balochistan is on edge again - what it means for Pakistan
content: Pakistan faces a deepening security crisis in Balochistan as the Baloch Liberation Army escalates its campaign through "Operation Herof. This surge impacts Pakistan's economy, foreign relations, and investor confidence. The region's strategic importance, particularly for China's Belt and Road Initiative and mineral resources, is now under strain.

title: EXPLAINED: How much will an India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup no-show cost?
content: Pakistan's boycott of the India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match is projected to cause a massive financial loss of USD 250 million. This decision risks significant revenue for all stakeholders, including the ICC and India's broadcaster, JioStar, which faces estimated advertising losses of Rs 200-250 crore.

title: As Amazon lays off 16000, AWS VP Greg Pearson tells employees: Continue using ...
content: Amazon has axed 16,000 corporate jobs, its second-largest layoff in months. Leadership is urging remaining staff to leverage technology for efficiency and support one another. This move aligns with CEO Andy Jassy's vision of AI driving future workforce changes and streamlining operations, while the company continues to invest in strategic areas.

title: Top 10 stocks to buy post Budget 2026
content: Budget 2026 stock market picks: Motilal Oswal Financial Services shares its top 10 stock picks that investors can consider buying. Here’s what the brokerage has to say:

title: Ex-ICC official accuses BCCI of mishandling Mustafizur Rahman exit, fueling T20 World Cup row
content: Former ICC official Sami-ul-Hasan Burney criticised the BCCI's public handling of Mustafizur Rahman's IPL exit, suggesting it triggered Bangladesh's withdrawal and Pakistan's forfeited match. Burney also highlighted PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi's view of the ICC's stance on match venue changes as "shifting of goalposts."

title: Oracle may layoff up to 30,000; one of the reasons is firm's 'commitment'
content: Oracle faces potential job cuts of 20,000-30,000 to fund its massive $156 billion OpenAI partnership. The company has already incurred significant debt for data centers, and rising borrowing costs are stalling projects. OpenAI is reportedly shifting some capacity to Microsoft and Amazon, raising concerns about Oracle's delivery capabilities.

title: 'Can't India-China ties be discussed?' Mahua Moitra on Parl ruckus over Rahul's remark
content: TMC MP Mahua Moitra criticised the Centre for labeling the Opposition as unpatriotic and restricting discussions on crucial foreign relations. The Parliament Budget Session saw heated exchanges when Rahul Gandhi attempted to quote from former Army Chief Naravane's unpublished memoir, which was disallowed by the Lok Sabha Speaker, escalating tensions.

title: John Harbaugh says he tried to stop Todd Monken from joining the Browns
content: The Cleveland Browns have hired Todd Monken as their new head coach, securing an offensive mind after a tense search.  John Harbaugh admitted he tried to keep Monken, highlighting the close call.  Monken's proven offensive success with the Ravens offers optimism for the Browns' future, especially with quarterback Shedeur Sanders.

title: Tesla's former Al Director posts long note about Moltbook, Elon Musk responds
content: Elon Musk reacted to Andrej Karpathy's observations on Moltbook, an AI agent platform, calling it an early stage of the technological singularity. Karpathy described the platform as a sci-fi takeoff-adjacent phenomenon where AI bots self-organize and interact autonomously, despite acknowledging its current chaotic nature and security risks.

title: ISL: FanCode awarded broadcast rights; KP Studios bag production rights
content: FanCode has been awarded the broadcast rights for the upcoming 2025-26 ISL season with KPS Studios bagging the production rights. A total of seven parties had shown interest. FanCode's overall bid of Rs 8.62 covers linear TV and digital streaming broadcasts. The truncated season gets underway on February 14 - after a five month delay.

title: 'Can't be any sanctions': Ex-PCB chief on why ICC can't punish Pakistan
content: Former Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chairman Ehsan Mani says the ICC cannot sanction Pakistan for skipping the India match, as the PCB is following government orders. He cites India’s earlier refusal to tour Pakistan without punishment. Mani blames the ICC for inaction and warns Pakistan could face revenue losses and sporting consequences.

title: Ariana Mukherjee sparks buzz with Mahima Chaudhry at low-key Mumbai outing
content: At a recent event in Mumbai, Mahima Chaudhry and her daughter Ariana Mukherjee showcased a charming blend of elegance and poise. Their effortless interaction with photographers during the launch of Variety Magazine India caught the attention of many, with audiences lauding Ariana's fresh demeanor and striking resemblance to her mother.

title: Graduate employability in India: Why Tier-1 colleges win bigger in non-tech jobs
content: A tier-wise snapshot from Mercer | Mettl’s India’s Graduate Skill Index 2025 shows Tier-1 colleges lead overall employability. But the gap doesn’t behave the same across roles. Technical employability is relatively close across tiers. Non-tech roles widen the spread. That suggests hiring rewards workplace-ready performance—writing, presentation, judgement—often shaped by campus exposure. For colleges, the message for colleges is that build this training into daily teaching and assessment, not as a last-minute add-on.

title: Congress vs Tharoor: A new beginning or temporary truce?
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has affirmed his commitment to the party and will actively campaign for the UDF in Kerala's upcoming assembly elections. Following a meeting with party leaders, Tharoor stated that differences were exaggerated and all are now on the same page. The Kerala Congress has also confirmed his prominent role in the election campaign.

title: As Travis Kelce’s NFL future remains uncertain, Taylor Swift makes history
content: Taylor Swift reached another major milestone as Billboard ranked her second all time in Hot 100 hits with 276 entries, the most by any woman. The achievement surfaced as Grammy events unfolded. Meanwhile, Travis Kelce faces uncertainty over his NFL future, with retirement still undecided, even as renewed ties with Chiefs coach Eric Bieniemy hint at a possible return season.

title: 'If Pakistan meet India in final, will they hand over the trophy?': Pak slammed by their ex-player
content: Former Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria criticises the decision to boycott the T20 World Cup match against India, stating it projects fear and harms Pakistan cricket. He argues the move, especially with the match shifted to Sri Lanka, lacks logic and complicates their path to the knockouts.

title: Rahul vs Shah, Rajnath: Parliament showdown over Naravane memoir — how it unfolded
content: Lok Sabha witnessed a heated exchange as Rahul Gandhi quoted from former Army chief General MM Naravane's unpublished memoir during the Motion of Thanks. Union ministers Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh objected, citing parliamentary rules against citing unpublished material. Gandhi defended his reference, stating it pertained to the Prime Minister's character.

title: Pakistan boycotts India T20 World Cup clash: Why teams skipped selective ICC matches before
content: Cricket faces another boycott controversy as Pakistan refuses to play India in the T20 World Cup 2026 on February 15. This echoes past incidents like the 1996 and 2003 World Cups, where teams forfeited matches due to security and political reasons. The ICC deems selective participation unacceptable, warning of consequences for Pakistan.

title: 'No money, no honey': Yuzvendra Chahal's latest social media post goes viral
content: Indian cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal went viral after sharing Thailand vacation photos with the caption “No Money, No Honey.” The post drew widespread attention. Amid ongoing dating rumours, actress Shefali Bagga slammed trolls over AI-generated posters linking her with Chahal, calling them “disgusting.” Chahal also reacted sarcastically. His personal life continues to fuel online buzz.

title: Fact check: Was Drake Maye accused of cheating on wife before Super Bowl?
content: Drake Maye and his wife, Ann Michael Maye, are the new fan favorites after their love story inspired billions around the world. The two have hardly been married for a year as many are now speculating that the star player has allegedly cheated on his newly wed wife. This originated after a few pictures went viral and here's all about the truth behind it.

title: Musk said he rebuffed Epstein. The emails tell a different story...
content: Between late 2012 and the end of 2013, Musk and Epstein exchanged multiple emails discussing island visits, parties, schedules, and logistics. Some plans fell through. Others were cancelled. But the emails show Musk actively engaging in conversations about going.

title: Valentine’s week calendar: Complete list of special days with romantic wishes & more
content: February ushers in Valentine's Week, a prelude to Valentine's Day on the 14th. Starting February 7th, each day offers a unique way to express love, from Rose Day to Kiss Day. This tradition, rooted in history and celebrating connections, culminates in a day dedicated to heartfelt gestures and cherished memories.

title: 3,500-year-old rhino bone fragments found in Western Ghats rewrite India’s wildlife map
content: Archaeological findings of rhino bones near Coimbatore reveal the species once roamed southern India, significantly expanding its known ancient range. This discovery contrasts with current conservation data showing the one-horned rhinoceros is now confined to specific regions in Northeast India and West Bengal, where populations are steadily increasing due to dedicated conservation efforts.

title: Australian Open: At the Happy Slam, not everyone was happy
content: In 2007, Roger Federer coined the term "Happy Slam" to describe the Australian Open - the first Grand Slam on the tennis calendar. 19 years later, he was back in Melbourne and explained the 'why' behind it. As three weeks of record attendance concluded, not everyone was quite 'happy' with how things turned out.

title: 'Cricket can open doors': Shahid Afridi's surprising post on Pakistan's India boycott
content: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi expressed regret over Pakistan's government decision to boycott the T20 World Cup match against India, stating he stands behind the government. This stance contrasts with his past remarks on keeping sports and politics separate, drawing criticism for seemingly supporting political interference in a major tournament.

title: Travis Kelce steps back from drama and retirement rumours as Swift wedding stalls
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's wedding have the whole world waiting but now, there are rumors of their wedding being reportedly delayed as the two deal with retirement rumors. Amid all this, it seems the star player is now taking a break from his regular life as he is all set to make a rare appearance in Arizona, possibly without Taylor Swift.

title: Sheikh Hasina convicted again: B'desh court hands 10-yr sentence in housing scam cases
content: A Bangladesh court has handed former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina a 10-year prison sentence in two corruption cases concerning plot allocations. Her niece, British MP Tulip Siddiq, received a four-year sentence.  The convictions stem from alleged irregularities in the Purbachal New Town project.  Hasina, living in exile, faces multiple other convictions.

title: Gold price today: How much 22K, 24K gold costs in your city today? Check rates
content: Precious metals experienced intense selling pressure on Monday, with gold and silver hitting lower circuit limits on the MCX due to aggressive profit-booking. Gold prices slumped 6%, while silver saw a sharper 12% correction, extending recent losses after a strong rally.

title: Video: 11 injured as SUV ploughs into crowd during festival rush; driver thrashed
content: A shocking incident unfolded on Sangli's Tilak Road as an SUV driver, Praniket Dattatrey Panchal, mowed down multiple vehicles and a crowd gathered for the Krushnamai Festival.  The driver was assaulted by locals before police intervention.  Eleven people, including five officers, sustained injuries, many with fractures, and were hospitalized.  A case has been filed.

title: ‘Nothing but drama’: Harbhajan Singh slams Pakistan's T20 World Cup boycott of India clash
content: Harbhajan Singh slammed Pakistan's decision to boycott their T20 World Cup match against India as "unnecessary drama." He questioned the logic behind the conditional approval, suggesting it's a ploy to mislead people and project solidarity with Bangladesh. Singh highlighted the ICC's rejection of Bangladesh's request and Pakistan's past revenue-driven approach to matches despite political tensions.

title: 'Restrain yourself from atrocities': Mamata vs Delhi Police ahead of CEC meet over SIR
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee arrived in Delhi for a meeting with the Election Commission amid political tension. She protested a heavy police presence outside Banga Bhavan, comparing the treatment to that of Union home minister Amit Shah's visits to West Bengal. Banerjee vowed to fight against alleged atrocities and harassment of people from Bengal.

title: What is ‘X spot’? Delhi runner's death near finish line at Indore marathon raises concerns
content: A 24-year-old Delhi-based runner, Aryan Todi, tragically collapsed and died just 100 meters from the finish line of a 21 km marathon in Indore. Despite immediate CPR and hospital efforts, doctors confirmed his death, with preliminary indications pointing to cardiac arrest during the high-risk "X spot" phase of the race.

title: Parked cars, house ramps & utilities shrink roads in Gurgaon, finds HC court panel
content: A Punjab and Haryana High Court-ordered commission found internal Gurgaon roads significantly narrower than their sanctioned width.  Physical inspections revealed motorable portions ranging from 3.9 to 4.8 meters, with ramps, electrical installations, and parking violations further constricting space. These findings are crucial for a PIL challenging Haryana's stilt-plus-four construction policy.

title: Karnataka woman hangs 3 kids, consumes diesel to end life over family dispute; survives
content: A woman in Hubballi allegedly hanged her three children before attempting suicide by consuming diesel. The incident, which occurred between 10 a.m. and 1:30 p.m., left all three children dead. The woman is in critical condition and undergoing treatment, with police awaiting her statement for further investigation.

title: MGU partners with foreign universities for global dual degrees
content: The university has formed academic partnerships with Ghent University (Belgium), Central European University (Vienna), and Leeds Beckett University (U.K.) to offer these programmes

title: Ministers review Mahashivratri arrangements at Srisailam; officials told to prioritise hassle-free darshan
content: Endowments Minister says the government is prioritising darshan for common devotees during festivities and directed officials to analyse the lapses from previous years to ensure preparedness for any issues that may arise

title: CPI(M) to observe black day against Union Budget on February 3
content: The CPI(M) State secretariat in a statement on Monday says that the State had raised 29 demands in a discussion with the Union Finance Minister before the Budget, but none were considered

title: An atmosphere of social harmony and communal goodwill prevails in Bihar: Governor
content: Arif Mohammad Khan says the State Government works for all sections of society, including Hindus, Muslims, upper castes, backward classes, extremely backward classes, Dalits, and Mahadalits

title: Bhagavad Gita now in indigenous Savji dialect; book release tomorrow
content: A translated version of the Bhagavad Gita in Savji dialect, an indigenous North Karnataka dialect, will be released in Hubballi on Wednesday

title: Walayar lynching victim’s brother launches protest against bail for accused
content: Ram Narayan’s brother Sasikanth Baghel urged the State government to move the High Court to seek cancellation of the bail, and also appoint a special public prosecutor to handle the case

title: Town Planning Committee to examine digital billboards as complaints mount
content: So far, around 12 large boards mounted on two pillar-like structures have been installed, streaming continuous digital commercials. The Corporation has received numerous complaints about these boards, which are now under consideration by the Town Planning Committee

title: In Delhi’s Urdu-medium schools, learning, shadowed by neglect
content: Delhi’s MCD-run Urdu-medium primary schools have seen dwindling student enrolment over a decade despite being located in highly populated areas whose residents speak the language. Suruchi Kumari finds that neglect is at the root of the state of education in these government-funded institutions

title: Syrian state forces deploy into Kurdish-run city under ceasefire deal
content: The deal, declared on January 30, has staved off further conflict between President Ahmed al-Sharaa's government and the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces, which ​lost swathes of eastern and northern Syria ⁠to government troops in January.

title: Don’t take law into own hands, TDP leaders tell cadres
content: Atchannaidu and Palla Srinivasa Rao caution activists against provocation, say YSRCP trying to create law and order problems and divert attention from Tirupati Laddu issue

title: ‘Balya Vivaha Vimukti Rath Yatra’ launched to combat child marriage in Puttaparthi
content: Superintendent of Police says such awareness programmes play a decisive role in sensitising communities, encouraging timely reporting, and preventing such practices at the grassroots level

title: KSWDC’s Escalera 2026 women’s fete begins today
content: Theme-based conclaves, entrepreneurship training sessions, exhibition-cum-sale, and cultural programmes will be held as part the week-long festival

title: Engineers should work to strengthen national preparedness, says Navy officer
content: He was delivering an address at the 25th VTU annual postgraduate convocation where 8,702 students graduated in Belagavi

title: Mudragada accuses Naidu of diverting attention from CBI laddu findings
content: Former Kapu Reservation Movement leader alleges Chief Minister is targeting Kapu leaders after probe found no adulteration in Tirumala laddu ghee

title: Union Budget 2026: No influence of issues with U.S. in customs duty cuts, says Nirmala Sitharaman
content: The Finance Minister added that the Centre has already started using cess proceeds, usually its domain exclusively, in matters that are in the States’ list of responsibilities

title: CPI(M) will make Dhanaraj martyr’s fund accounts public, says Govindan
content: Party will disclose the accounts at a press conference on February 6, following a directive from the State leadership to clear doubts among cadre

title: State govt. urged to pass strict law to protect employees from assault
content: Through staff are working under immense pressure, abuse and attacks from the public have been increasing, says association

title: Bihar posts 13.1% growth in 2024-25, surpasses national average: economic survey
content: Despite the positive economic performance, Bihar continues to have the lowest per capita income in the country, says economist.

title: Sambhal mosque seeks permission for loudspeaker installation ahead of Ramzan
content: Committee president Zafar Ali, in a letter to the district magistrate on February 2, said a loudspeaker was required during Ramzan so that the Imam's voice could be clearly heard by the worshippers offering prayers at the mosque

title: Ajit Pawar’s son Parth breaks down while holding father’s chair at NCP office
content: Parth Pawar, son of the late Ajit Pawar, was deeply emotional at a prayer ceremony for his father's ashes, embracing an empty chair. NCP Maharashtra president Sunil Tatkare announced plans to take the ashes across the state for public homage. He also affirmed the NCP's commitment to the NDA, emphasizing their continued adherence to secular principles and social justice ideals.

title: Pune Porsche case: SC grants regular bail to 3 accused in juvenile blood swap
content: The Supreme Court has granted regular bail to three individuals accused in the Pune Porsche crash case. The incident, which occurred on May 19, 2024, involved a 17-year-old allegedly driving a Porsche Taycan and fatally striking two 24-year-old tech professionals.

title: ‘We completely agree with ICC’: BCCI VP on Pakistan boycotting India match at T20 WC
content: The BCCI fully supports the ICC's stance on sportsmanship after Pakistan's government announced their team would boycott the T20 World Cup match against India. BCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla stated they will await formal discussions with the ICC before commenting further. The ICC emphasised that selective participation undermines the integrity of global sporting events.

title: Mysuru MP welcomes Union Budget, says it aims to realise ‘Developed India’
content: Hailing the budget as people-centric, Mysuru MP Wadiyar claimed the proposed COSMOS training centre to significantly benefit people in the region

title: ‘Jana Nayagan’ censor row: Can’t reveal anything, says CBFC Regional Officer
content: “All our examination process is confidential. We cannot reveal anything until a certificate is issued,” says CBFC Chennai Regional Officer D. Balamurali.

title: Congress launches ‘Kadakku Purathu’ digital offensive against LDF
content: The KPCC is attempting to turn Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan’s own words into a political weapon, framing the campaign as a public demand for his exit from power

title: Congress spokesperson accuses NCB of behaving like BJP’s ‘agent’
content: KPCC spokesperson M. Lakshman challenges the NCB to provide evidence of drug seizures at a phenyl manufacturing facility in Hebbal

title: Siddaramaiah trying to become leader of South India, says Vijayendra
content: The Chief Minister, in his reaction to the Union Budget, has tried to instigate the Southern states against the Centre, says the State BJP president

title: Budget 2026: Activists flag ‘opacity, underfunding’ in rural jobs schemes
content: Activists say ₹30,000 crore for MGNREGS is unclear and likely to be absorbed by dues; warn Centre’s ₹95,692 crore for VB‑GRAMG is far below what’s needed for 125 days of work

title: Medical college doctors boycott OP services indefinitely in Kerala
content: Demands include payment of pay revision arrears pending since 2016, rectification of pay revision anomalies and appointment of more doctors. Academic activities in medical colleges have come to a halt from January 22.

title: Himachal Pradesh govt. sets goal of 31% forest cover by 2030
content: Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu directs the Forest department to prepare a comprehensive roadmap through sustainable planning to increase the State’s forest cover, which is currently 29.5%

title: Lok Bhavan disapproves of Tamil Nadu government constituting, extending Vice-Chancellor search committees
content: Contending that Tamil Nadu government’s action is contrary to judicial orders, Lok Bhavan says, “It is a matter of serious concern that these committees have been constituted and are functioning without a nominee of the Chairman, UGC.”

title: We were insulted and humiliated, says West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee after meeting ECI
content: Mamata Banerjee, along with TMC MPs and families affected by the SIR process, visited ECI to flag discrepancies, including cases where living voters were listed as “dead”

title: Opposition stages walkout, boycotts Kerala Assembly proceedings
content: Move in the wake of Speaker disallowing its notice for an adjournment motion on granting parole to a CPI(M) councillor serving a 20-year prison sentence after being involved in an attempt to kill police personnel by hurling a bomb. Ruling front terms it a non-issue

title: Raut cites Ajit Pawar's statement on BJP 'scam' file, casts doubts on death; ruling party hits back
content: "Ajit Pawar was constantly saying that he has a file of the BJP's scam and he will make a revelation of this. He said this on January 15 and he died in an accident in the next 10 days. This is mysterious," says Sanjay Raut

title: Supreme Court issues notices to Centre, 12 States on PIL by Christian body against anti-conversion laws
content: The counsel for the National Council of Churches in India said that a few State laws are such that it “incentivises vigilante groups to complain” against so-called conversions, and hence many complaints are being filed

title: Periye twin murder case convict granted parole again
content: 10th accused in the case was released on parole two-and-a half months ago. Jail authorities say all norms have been adhered to

title: Three of family succumb after sustaining severe burns in kitchen fire at home in Kanakapura in Bengaluru
content: According to the police, a fire broke out in the kitchen due to an accidental gas stove leak while food was being prepared

title: Fake SSLC question papers circulated on Instagram, Karnataka’s School Education Department files complaint
content: On January 27, images claiming to be that of the First Language Kannada question paper were posted on Instagram, followed by posts on January 28 purportedly showing the mathematics question paper

title: Two tigers found dead in Madhya Pradesh’s Shahdol district
content: On January 20, the Madhya Pradesh High Court issued notices to the Centre and the State government over the rise in tiger deaths in the State

title: E. Sreedharan opens office for high-speed rail project at Ponnani
content: Technocrat claims he was asked by Union Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw to prepare a detailed project report for the proposed ₹1 lakh-crore high-speed rail corridor. State govt. sceptical about claim as no mention was made about it in the Union Budget

title: R. Ashok questions silence of Karnataka Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar on Brand Bengaluru, absence from House
content: Leader of Opposition R. Ashok claimed that D.K. Shivakumar had visited over 100 temples and performed abhisheka, and sarcastically suggested that the Chief Minister allot the Muzari portfolio to him

title: Supreme Court notice on challenge to Kerala HC’s dismissal of plea on appointment of temple priests
content: The plea challenges a Kerala High Court decision that temple priests must be appointed in accordance with religious texts

title: Pilgrims visit Yallamma temple in Saundatti for Bharat Hunnime festival
content: The Saundatti Yallamma Temple Development Authority and the district administration had taken several steps to provide facilities to pilgrims

title: Around 52,000 women denied Gruha Lakshmi benefits in Karnataka due to tax records; issue being addressed, says Minister
content: The Minister said that the issue had arisen because beneficiary details matched records of the GST and Income Tax Departments, leading to withholding of payments under the scheme

title: India's Budget advances critical reforms across customs and strategic sectors that boost investment: USISPF
content: “The support in the Budget for semiconductors, electronics manufacturing, healthcare, agriculture, and logistics will help fuel next-generation growth,” the President and CEO of USISPF said

title: Labour Codes benefiting only corporate sector, alleges CPI State executive member Kameswara Rao
content: We request all workers to take part in the nation-wide strike proposed on February 12 to demand reintroduction of Labour Laws to ensure job protection and 8 hours-work, the Left party leader said

title: CPI veteran R. Nallakannu hospitalised in Chennai
content: Mr. Nallakannu, who turned 101 in December 2025, was admitted on Sunday (February 1, 2026) evening after a couple of bouts of vomiting

title: Temperatures to remain above normal in Andhra Pradesh in Febuary
content: The forecast indicates higher probability of above-normal daytime temperatures in Rayalaseema and a few pockets in NCAP, it does not yet say by what degrees the deviation is going to be, Director IMD said

title: Suspended Bareilly magistrate threatens Delhi stir from February 7 over SC/ST Act
content: Alankar Agnihotri alleged that 85% of the population was affected by the SC/ST Act and claimed that 95% of cases registered under it were false, adding that upper-caste organisations across the country were backing his stand

title: Congress holds night-long satyagraha against scrapping of MGNREGA in Mysuru
content: The night-long satyagraha at Town Hall featured documentaries on MGNREGA and Dr. B. R. Ambedkar, biopic on Mahatma Gandhi, and speeches by Congress leaders

title: Supreme Court grants bail to SAD leader Bikram Singh Majithia in disproportionate assets case
content: Supreme Court emphasised the prolonged detention of Majithia, who has been in custody for seven months, while also instructing the Punjab Vigilance Bureau to expedite its investigation

title: New church inaugurated in Belagavi
content: Deputy Commissioner Mohammed Roshan urges people to live stress-free lives while contributing positively to society

title: Building startups in Kerala: what a decade of Kerala Startup Mission shows
content: From college labs to global markets, Kerala Startup Mission’s decade-long push has shaped how founders scale ideas across robotics, agritech and edtech. From 300 startups in 2016 to over 7,800 today, how has the State shaped Kerala’s technology ecosystem?

title: Uproar in Lok Sabha after Rahul Gandhi seeks to quote from former Army chief Naravane’s ‘memoir’
content: Rahul Gandhi rose to speak on the Motion of Thanks to the President's address, he said he would first like to respond to the charges made by the previous speaker, BJP MP Tejasvi Surya, against the Congress on nationalism.

title: Sheikh Hasina sentenced to 10 years in jail by Bangladesh court in two corruption cases
content: The court sentenced 78-year-old Ms. Hasina, her nephew Radwan Mujib Siddiq, and her nieces, Tulip Rizwana Siddiq and Azmina Siddiq, and others

title: Vivo leads India’s smartphone market while Apple earns the most
content: In 2026, India’s smartphone market is projected to see a single-digit volume decline as rising memory and component costs weigh on demand

title: Squash: Anahat Singh beats world No.10 Georgina Kennedy
content: It is the biggest title of young Anahat’s career, and the 15th overall on the PSA Tour for the Indian world No. 31 in 26 tournaments

title: J&K elections after a gap of several years a significant milestone, says J&K L-G Manoj Sinha in budget speech
content: “Sustained reforms in transparency, accountability, digital governance, and citizen-centric service delivery have significantly strengthened public trust and institutional efficiency,” the J&K L-G said.

title: Historical 743-year old Kalingarayan aqueduct in Erode to be razed to make way for new structure
content: The aqueduct had undergone several renovations during the British period. However, leakages from the structure had increased over the years, and repeated repair attempts failed, leaving replacement as the only viable option

title: 14 migrant workers stranded in Dubai, appeal to Jharkhand government for safe return
content: Team leader of the State migrant control cell said that they have been informed about the 14 migrant workers from Giridih, Hazaribag and Bokaro districts who have sent a video alleging that the private company has not paid wages

title: Student dies on BITS Pilani Goa campus; 6th incident in 2 years
content: Vishnavi Jitesh (20), a third-year engineering student, was found dead in her hostel room late on February 1 night

title: The Hindu Editorial | Credible and creditable: On Union Budget 2026-27
content: Budget 2026 avoids major direct tax cuts, raising concerns for individuals and corporations seeking relief. Fiscal prudence and subdued revenue projections signal a cautious approach amid global economic uncertainties.

title: Tuskegee hoops coach led off court in handcuffs
content: Benjy Taylor, the men's basketball coach at Division II Tuskegee University, was escorted off the court in handcuffs after a postgame incident Saturday.

title: Lightning say goalie fight key in historic comebac...
content: The Lightning credited the first goalie fight in an NHL outdoor game -- between Andrei Vasilevskiy and Jeremy Swayman -- for helping to spark their historic Stadium Series comeback win over the Bruins on Sunday.

title: LeBron named All-Star reserve, extending record
content: LeBron James is an NBA All-Star for a record-extending 22nd consecutive year after the league announced its reserves for the Feb. 15 midseason showcase Sunday night.

title: NFL inks multiyear deal to play games in Madrid
content: The NFL has announced it will play more regular-season games in Real Madrid's Santiago Bernabeu Stadium. The teams that will play in 2026 are TBD.

title: Sources: Reds land slugger Suarez with $15M deal
content: Slugger Eugenio Suárez and the Reds have agreed to a one-year, $15 million contract that includes a mutual option for the 2027 season, sources told ESPN.

title: Pastrnak vents about nullified OT goal: 'A joke'
content: David Pastrnak said it was "a joke" that his apparent winning overtime goal was nullified by a penalty in the Bruins' eventual 6-5 shootout loss to the Lightning on Sunday.

title: Sources: Kubiak to try to reach deal with Raiders
content: The Raiders are expected to hire Seahawks offensive coordinator Klint Kubiak as their next head coach after the Super Bowl, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Spurs earn Johnson All-Star Game coaching nod
content: After a whirlwind travel day that began at 6 a.m. in Charlotte and included a flight diversion to Atlanta, the Spurs beat the Magic 112-103 on Sunday night to clinch an All-Star Game coaching nod for Mitch Johnson in his first full season at the helm.

title: 🏈 59 Super Bowl rings, 59 unique stories to tell
content: They've been lost while surfing in Hawaii and dancing at Studio 54. Ahead of Super Bowl LX, learn a unique story of one ring from every championship.

title: The Luka trade, one year later: What the Mavs, Lak...

title: Man Slits Woman's Throat In Dehradun, Arrested: Cops
content: A woman was allegedly murdered in broad daylight after a man slit her throat with a sharp weapon here on Monday, police said.

title: "Can Get Lakhs Of People To Delhi": Mamata Banerjee Targets Poll Body Over SIR
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has brought the SIR battle to the national capital. After meeting Election Commission officials today, she gave an open threat: "I can get lakhs of people to Delhi to parade before the Election Commission."

title: Before Real Estate Tycoon CJ Roy's Suicide, Petition Against Tax Raids, Then 'U-Turn'
content: Days after realtor and businessman CJ Roy was found dead in his Bengaluru office, questions persist regarding the circumstances that led him to take such an extreme step.

title: Father, Compounder, Help: 3 Men At Centre Of Jodhpur Sadhvi's Death Probe
content: The investigation into the death of 25-year-old religious preacher Sadhvi Prem Baisa in Rajasthan has narrowed down to three men whose presence at her ashram on the evening of January 28 is now central to the police inquiry.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Real Reason Mamata Has Taken The SIR Fight To Delhi
content: Mamata plans to turn the SIR controversy to the Trinamool's advantage as she prepares to contest for a fourth term as Chief Minister.

title: Supreme Court Bail For Akali's Bikram Majithia A Setback For AAP
content: The Supreme Court granting bail to Shiromani Akali Dal leader Bikram Singh Majithia in the disproportionate assets (DA) case marks a clear political setback for the ruling Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in Punjab.

title: Gaza's Rafah Crossing Reopens With Limited Access, No Goods To Pass Through
content: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt reopened on Monday for limited traffic, a key step in the Israel-Hamas ceasefire but a mostly symbolic development on the ground as few people will be allowed to travel in either direction.

title: 70-Year-Old Woman Run Over By Train In UP: Cops
content: A 70-year-old woman died after being hit by a train on a rail bridge in Jamui Bazaar area here on Monday, police said.

title: Parliament Budget Session 2026 Live: Rahul Gandhi Raises Ladakh Stand-Off In Lok Sabha, Rajnath Singh Intervenes

title: Unrest In Andhra Over Remarks On C Naidu, 2 Opposition Leaders Targetted
content: Political tension has escalated in Andhra Pradesh as the supporters of the ruling Telugu Desam Party or TDP allegedly attacked the residences of senior YSR Congress Party or YSRCP leaders over the weekend.

title: Night Raids, Mutilated Bodies: Baloch Group Reports Deepening Rights Crisis
content: A new human rights report released by Paank, the human rights department of the Baloch National Movement (BNM), paints a grim and disturbing picture of life in Balochistan during December 2025.

title: Rahul Gandhi vs Rajnath Singh Over Ex-Army Chief's Book On Ladakh Stand-Off
content: Leader of Opposition (LoP) in Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi, began his speech in Parliament today by holding out a magazine article on an unpublished book by former Army chief, General MM Naravane on the Ladakh stand-off between India and China in 2020.

title: Dalit Groom Attacked With Swords For Riding Horse In Gujarat
content: In an era where India projects itself as a global tech leader and a progressive superpower, a village in Gujarat's Patan district has served as a reminder of the deep-seated caste fissures that still haunt the country's hinterlands.

title: India Holds Firm Against International Court Order On Indus Waters Treaty
content: Even as a Court of Arbitration in The Hague presses ahead with fresh hearings and document orders under the Indus Waters Treaty framework, India has made it clear that it does not recognise the legitimacy of these proceedings and will not participate

title: Woman, 2 Others Die As In-Laws Plant Arsenic-Laced Sweets Near Her House
content: The first victim was Dashru Yaduvanshi, 50, the on-duty security guard, who tasted the sweets and soon developed violent vomiting and diarrhoea.

title: Danish Couple's 7,000 km India Journey To Find Adopted Son's Mother
content: In a quiet corner of Telangana's Adilabad district, a couple from Denmark, Louis and Rasmus, have travelled thousands of miles to India in search of the birth mother of their adopted son, Arjun, also known as Danish.

title: Who Is Shubham Lonkar, Accused Of Firing Outside Rohit Shetty's Residence
content: The name of Pune-based Shubham Lonkar, linked to the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, has surfaced again following the firing incident outside filmmaker Rohit Shetty’s Mumbai residence.

title: Deaf, Mute, Blind Students At Odisha School Sexually Abused By Male Warden
content: Multiple students, both girls and boys, of an Odisha school have accused a male warden of physical and sexual harassment.

content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Monday alleged the "torture" and "atrocities" of Bengalis in the national capital, hours before she was scheduled to lead a Trinamool Congress delegation to meet Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar.

title: "I Have A Crush On You": Inside Emails In Epstein Files Related To Bill Clinton
content: New details about Jeffrey Epstein and his long-time associate Ghislaine Maxwell's communication with former US President Bill Clinton's staff have emerged in the latest tranche of files related to the serial sex offender.
